content.detailedDescription:
The following sighting took place between 9-10 p.M. on the 4th of july in livingston county, michigan. two small white orbs were visible in the south over the tree line moving toward the west. the objects were maintaining level flight and traveling at a continuous velocity, keeping an equal distance between each other.

i went in and alerted the second witness who also viewed the objects, discounting them as ���flares.��� i continued to watch the fireworks and three more ���train lights��� appeared over the tree line in the same area as the first two and traveled in the same (direction, formation, and speed).  they were not aircraft as they were not strobing green/red and they never made any noise.

once again i went in and alerted the second witness to come outside, we both stood in the yard watching the objects ���float��� across the sky. at this point more of the similar objects appeared over the tree line to the north, traveling south to the same relative area in the sky.

when i noticed the objects coming from the north they started out as a bright yellow/white light (train light), turning red as they came closer. when the objects passed overhead they fizzled out and just their circular black outlines were visible. 

as one of the dark object traveled from an overhead position to the south, an exploding firework illuminated it just above the tree line. this allowed me to view the side of the side of the dark object, which had a shape likened to a muffin (circular on the bottom then rounded with a dome on the top.) when the object was illuminated it appeared to be grey in color.

after that the second witness encouraged me to go inside and get my camera phone and take a video of one of the objects coming from the north, moving towards the south.

reflecting on the incident these objects made no noise, traveled in a similar direction, all at slow consistent speeds. all the objects had similar flight characteristics, appearances, shape, and sizes. as the objects moved to the south their color became faint, ?Due to  increased altitude? then they would fade into the southern sky and more would follow from the north.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering,Other
content.shape: Circle,   Disc,   Egg,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: Red orbs  (+20)

content.detailedDescription:
I've been watching airplanes all my life, and i'm a star-gazer too.  i've seen countless airplanes, satellites, the international space station, and the space shuttle fly over. and these orange lights have me spooked.  i've never seen anything like it. and they were orange, not red-orange, and not yellow-orange, just a deep orange color.

there were at least 3 (i saw them between trees). i noticed one at first, and the solid orange, size, and speed were enough to make me take notice and be curious.  but then i noticed the other two, which seemed to be in "formation", with one ahead of the other.  then i tried to locate the first one again, but i couldn't find it. 

i stood and watched the other two as they moved away, and saw one catch up with the other and seemingly pass it, before it faded away, as the eastern sky either had haze or clouds.  then i watched the remaining one until it, too, faded into the distance.  i should also point out that there was a large full moon rising in the southeast at this time.  but these lights were headed pretty much due east.

if they were moving slower, and weren't orange, i would think they were a formation of 3 helicopters, with one being way off the side.  but not likely.  

first, no sound at all.  i live in a quiet area, and it was very quiet at the time, and even though they had already passed me, if they were helicopters, i would have heard something beforehand, and still heard it fading away as i stepped outside.  but not a sound.  

second, the speed in which they were moving wasn't correct.  if you've watched the iss fly over, this was about 1.5 times that speed, meaning if they were at high altitude, they were moving fast.  at first i thought i was seeing the iss, except that it was way too large, and bright orange, almost glowing.  then of course the fact that there were 3 of them. and at this speed, and the distance they seemed to be from me, i don't think helicopters can move that fast.

third, i was also seeing planes in the distance, in a pattern, that had taken off from o'hare airport and heading south.  so if these lights were helicopters, or any other aircraft, i don't think they would have had clearance to pass through chicagoland like that, in that direction (west to east), crossing the airplane traffic.  unless they were at a very high altitude and would not interfere with other planes in the area.

i am perplexed, and i can't stop thinking about this.  whatever i saw was definitely not ordinary.  it was either aircraft with a new type of lighting (no flashing, just solid orange, is that even allowed?), or some type of experiment, such as planes traveling at high altitude with large, solid orange lights, or something very spectacular.  i have never, ever seen anything like it before. 

and i can tell you this, if these lights moving any faster, i actually would have been scared.  at the speed they were moving, it did seem like they were possibly man-made, and felt that there could be some explanation.  but i cannot explain what they could have been, or what altitude, or what speed.

i really hope that i wasn't the only one that saw them, and also hope that they can be explained, because it's really bothering me.
content.summary: 3 bright orange lights moving east in "formation", 2 together, 1 off to the side

content.detailedDescription:
I live in the belle isle/pine castle area near lake conway.  my wife and i were out watching fireworks last night (july 4th) around 9:00 pm when we saw 3 reddish lights moving at the speed of a helicopter travelling in a line.  the can not really be determined, but seemed like they were travelling south to north.  there was no change in size until all of a sudden the first one seemed to get smaller and disappeared, followed by the second one and then the third with about 15 seconds apart.  i am glad my wife was with me to witness this as she would have thought i was completely nuts.

 

we know what planes look like and even helicopters which tend to circle this area.  i also know that the airport would not have let planes fly this close to each other. they were not high in the sky but rather low on the horizon, almost at the same level that planes on fnal descent are on, yet  these seemed to be moving in the opposite direction.

 

maybe 5-10 minutes passed and a 4th light appeared in the same area following the same pattern.  my wife ran into the house to grab our binoculars, but before she could return, this one two disappeared in similar fashion as the other three.
content.summary: Red lights travelling near orlando international airport

content.detailedDescription:
Unknown objects are frequenting our skies. my family and i observed white orbs approx. 30 days ago and have since been watching the sky nightly. on most clear nights between the hours of 9:30 p.M. and 11:30 p.M. (seems to be peak viewing hours) we see 5 to 10 orbs of different colors and varying degrees of brightness.
last during during the monroeville fireworks we watched one bright red orb approach at a fairly low altitude from the west heading east. it made no sound. we thought at first that it might have been a news helicopter but with the lack of sound, no other lighting, and it's sudden disappearance it couldn't have been that. perhaps it was a roman candle? we don't know.
the second bright red orb appeared 30 minutes later and also vanished before it reached us. 
is anyone else in our parts watching the sky and seeing these objects? especially the glowing/brightening/dimming white orbs that we are seeing every time the sky is clear enough for viewing. they usually travel from the north or northwest/ or south or southeast heading toward the opposite direction. sometimes they change direction slightly and/or appear to wobble. occasionally they seem to almost come to a complete stop and shine brilliantly...Much bigger and brighter than any other star/planet in the sky and then shoot away quickly after dimming considerably.
our feelings are of curiosity, intrigue, anxiety and amazement. we really don't know what to think about the things we are seeing.
i need to get a binocular video camera to try to capture some of film.
content.summary: Bright red orb observed during fireworks

content.detailedDescription: We were driving home from fireworks on cayuga lake (ovid, ny) and when we reached watkins glen, ny i noticed 5 red/orange orbs in the sky that looked similar to a star formation.  it was shaped with 4 of them making a diamond with the 5th one off to the bottom of the diamond.  in the vehicle along with me were my wife, our friend and our two children.  we all saw this in disbelief.  i parked the car for a moment and we sat dumbfounded for a couple of minutes before even thinking to grab our camera phones to video tape it.  as we grabbed our phones, the objects moved and simply disappeared before we could record anything.  there had been odd lightning high in the atmosphere earlier on.  it glowed an orange/red and we kept commenting on how eerie it was.  this was a bizarre event and although i was a skeptic before, i have to admit i am a believer today.  there is simply no logical explanation for what we all witnessed.
content.summary: 5 flickering red/orange orbs hovering and then move and disappear

content.detailedDescription:
Standing with neighbor in front yard, we all saw 3 orange/reddish lights 
spread very far apart floating threw the sky for about 2 minutes. the top light faded to black the the middle one faded and finally the 3rd faded to black. these were way to high elevation to be fireworks. it kept all of us fixated on object from first sighting to the end.
content.summary: Three star like objects,spread apart. slow moving than faded away, lasted around 2 minutes

content.detailedDescription:
While i was watching several neighborhood fireworks to the west i observed a large red bright light flying at a high altitude at a slow speed from south to north. i watched it for about 3 minutes and then it disappeared. the light pulsed at time but never blinked and no other lights were observed at the time. 
the color was similar to an object i saw in january of this year however it was stationary over a shopping plaza , it was smaller and slowly disappeared after about 2 minutes of watching it with a couple of people.
they also told me they saw a v formation of the same lights over the ocean on new years eve as well.
content.summary: Red light seen during 4th of july fireworks

content.detailedDescription: My friend and her family and i were watching fireworks go off for the fourth of july on the side of a hill that over looks the bay. while we were watching the fireworks i looked up in the sky and noticed a slow moving object floating above the treetops. it was an orange amber color, that was giving off a luminous glow. my friend's father told us it was an airplane and that we shouldn't pay any mind to it. we noticed there were no flashing lights and watched it float across the sky. it went over the tree tops from north to south, it was floating very slowly. we turned around for a second to look at a firework that had gone off, we turned around and the orange object was gone. nowhere to be found.
content.summary: Orange round orb floating slowly in sky

content.detailedDescription:
My sister-in-law, brother and myself were lighting fireworks in their back yard.She got our attention about a light in the south east. my brother commented wouldn't that be wild if that was a ufo. i live behind their home and i was able to grab my binoculars and focus in on it. my binocts are 10x50 and there were not any green and red required faa lights to be seen by naked eye or by my binocts. this orb traveled from the south east towards the north west. it seemed to have a slight right turn and made no noise. this orb had a solid orange-yellow glow. i wasn't sure what it was, but i can tell what it wasn't. i've seen the military c-130s to f18s,f22s, cargo copters to light prop planes going to or from dallas / loves field this orb traveled faster than a plane, but slower than fighter jets inbound or outbound from airport. this all happened in just seconds. taking a guess this was over in 11 sec or a bit more before it went behind our tree. to describe my feelings and mind set, i was energized this whole event started 10:06or :07 and was over about 12secs later.

































+++++++++++------------
content.summary: Orb shape, faster than a plane, but slower than fight jet. just out of focus of a10x50 binocs.

content.detailedDescription:
It was around 1030 pm on july 4th, 2012 when i had walked down the street to the edge of the bluff to overlook the puget sound and see all of the fireworks shows from all the different cities across the water - on the different islands.  i was watching the gig harbor show alone at this point as everyone else in the group had gone in different directions to try and find other vantage points, and the three tree point show had just started and was very close to me, but somewhat obscured from the 150ft+ tall bluff that was standing on.  at some point, i see what appears to be just another firework that had just been launched, but this one was traveling at an extremely acute angle from the water and was passing behind the tree tops below me.  as i am watching that, the gig harbor show is hitting the crescendo and really popping, as well as about 15 more shows that i can see from there when i realize that this "firework" is still going.   i mean, it hasn't detonated yet. now, the thing is totally unobscured and ascending at a nice steady pace on the slightest ever, upward-curving arc of a trajectory, almost in a straight line. about this time i am thinking "this is a ufo!"  -when suddenly from behind me and elevated even more than i, was a large group of folks in a yard were asking "what is that?!"  i turned and asked "you see that too?!"  the entire group saw it and one guy kept repeating, "that ain't right, that ain't right" the children were asking if it was a helicopter or plane, and we all studied it as it left our atmosphere in a fading glint as it got so small we could no longer see it.   at which point i said, that was not one of ours...  i asked if they had seen where it came from and if had exited the water and they said they didnt witness that part, it was just there and started it ascent. the group were all silent now and i see my family walking back down the hill right by their yard, and i could hardly contain myself and asked did you see the ufo?! to my dismay they started laughing at me and said no in an incredulous manner. as they were snickering i said all those people right there saw it, right?  they all agreed and were astounded amazed and talking about it as we returned back home, up the hill.

i would estimate the object was roughly in between 1-2 miles away from me, leaving the surface or from under the surface of the puget sound between three tree point and vashon island. the object itself was glowing an orange color and slightly pulsating at an irregular rate. it's tought to estimate the size, as most of it appeared to be corona, so it could have been anywhere from 20ft across to 40ft. its speed was slow and steady, no unusual changes in course or disappearances.  we were looking ssw and it was on a trajectory that was leaving away from us at a sse direction. it continued to climb slow and steady, on an almost arc-like line, but ever so slight, until it slowly faded out against the hazy sky.  the entire event taking place in about 1 minute.

it looked like a firework that was shot horizontally from a boat out in the middle of the bay, that slowly climbed into space, never detonating.  i suppose it could have been a dud of a firework, but it was the best dud i've ever seen!   and it actually was way cooler than the awesome shows that we got to see!! 

there literally had to be hundreds and hundreds of people that witnessed that from down below.  and i doubt there will be a whisper about it in the news.
content.summary: 4th of july fireworks/ufo event - three tree point / burien, wa

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting right on the river across the way from downtown portland, when i noticed one red-orange glowing orb. i watched it for about 40 to 50 seconds before it disapeared, about 5 minutes later i saw another... and another... and 2 more came from behind the first 2 within seconds of each other untill a set of 3 apeared in a perfect triangle formation  with at least 5 or 6 following behind. my geuss is i saw more than 20 of those orbs in only a few minutes, they just wouldnt stop! every orb went in the same line each time for about 1 minute before dispearing. i wasnt the only person that saw them, i was with at least 20 other people and was loud enough to get every one to see the orbs right as the triangle formation apeared. sadly nobody seemed to care and blamed them on firworks/flares/baloons ect....(the big fireworks show had already been finished for at least 20 minutes) when i got home i hopped online to see if there were other reports, i was shocked to see others from all over the usa were seeing the same thing i saw and roughly at the same time! 

cheers!
content.shape: Circle,   Disc,   Fireball,   Oval,   Sphere,   Star-like
content.summary: Red-orange g;owing ords over ne/se portland. triangle formation+ 15 or more crafts

content.detailedDescription: I was on vacation on eua (june), and my family and i went to lunch to china buffet on june 21, located on 2001 west southwest loop 323, tyler, tx 75701, and when we were leaving the restaurant, and while my aunts are talking, i decided take a photos serial of the place, and i take three photos on less than a minute, and my family and i did not see any object, or airplane or similar at that moment. but, when i was reviewing all the photos of the trip, i found one photo of this series and saw this amazing object in the sky on the second (of three) photos serial from this angle. i was really surprised, and i talked to all my aunts that was on the restaurant, and ask they if they remember an airplane, helicopter or sound of that kind of ships, but they didn't remember nothing. the sun was very shiny at the moment of the shoot, and i did not have sunglasses, and was very annoying see the sky, that was the reason because i only shot without saw what exactly i was captured. the object looks like a fish, but i think the was oval o like a boomerang. is important to note, that the hour and date of the register of my camera has one hour early and a wrong date, because, i had the honduras hour and because i had wrong configuration of the am-pm item, i did not change during my vacation. the object had to fly very fast, because i captured the object in one picture of three takes that i made in less than a minute. sorry by my english, but i am learning. thank for made the analysis of these material y sharing with me the results. i blurred the faces of my family. regards
content.summary: I took a photographic, and i capture an object

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside taking in the fresh air & my attention was suddenly distracted from this ball of fire in the sky! this happened at 02:10am est on july 5th, 2012. i was so shocked & in awe, i could not move. this fireball headed east in a slow steady speed, gradually changed its path towards southeast. i was finally able to run inside, inform my husband about this, and when i came right back, the fireball was heading west/southwest, fire flame like colors were slowly fading as it was picking up speed & looked like it was losing altitude and looked like it was going to crash. i lost sight of the fireball once it was blocked by a building in front of me.

i have called a local news radio station, the regional & local faa, & a respected local news station and have informed them all about this incident. i may sound crazy to them but i now know that others have seen this in other states in the us.

i really wish i had grabbed my husband's binoculars or video taped this because it was the scariest thing i have ever seen in the sky.
content.summary: Ball of fire, looked like plane on fire!

content.detailedDescription:
Witnessed glowing orange orb twice..     first time, it ascended slowly, and then fast and flickered out. 

re-appeared 1 to 2 minutes later in a different spot hovering for a minute or so before radically moving east and flickering out again.
content.summary: Bright glowing object over las vegas

content.detailedDescription:
My daughter lives in n.W. boise, id. she and family were outside doing fireworks. she noted a red glowing orb(marble-sized at arms-length) generally moving north to south. she said it looked like it was on fire(just the color....Not smoke or flames). that first one seemed to split in two just before it disappeared to her south.
then shortly thereafter three more came from the north and were all three in her view at the same time. later two more passed her position with one actually seeming to curve to the southeast and disappear. i, she and her family are all airplane buffs(airshows etc;), so know what different aircraft look and sound like. these made no sound. she called me to make the observation to me(i had seen ufo's in my earlier life)and i went out with 10x binoculars to look for myself. there was a moderate cloud cover starting from over my house(meridian, id)and stretching towards her area. i did use the stars to get my binoculars adjusted for infinity but thought i would not see anything because of the cloud cover. after waiting for about 10 min. i noted a bright red 'largest-star'-sized moving object moving generally north to south roughly between her house and mine. so that confirmed(to me)her general observation. i used a steady-rest to stop the wobbling and watched the object move slowly and then actually slow almost to a stop. then, it either slowly diminished in brightness or it got into the clouds. it then was no longer seen by me. length of time observed 5-10 min. waited a while longer and no other appeared. came inside to write this report. my daughters observation was probably within an hour of my sighting, in case you want to verify this with other reports possibly from the boise area.
secondarily, my daughter tried to use a cellphone camera to get a picture but it just didn't work. i don't have any useable cameras at the present time.
content.summary: Daughter lives 4 miles from me. she seen multiple(6) red moving orbs and called me. i went out, looked in her dir. and seen the one.

content.detailedDescription: We were outside my friend's house watching fireworks. we had seen one of these orange lights a few minutes before but dismissed it as a plane but after seeing several more close together heading in the same direction we thought it may be something else. the objects appeared in the western sky and had sort of a fire-like color to them (reddish orange). they had a slight flicker like stars and headed north to where they disappeared. they all  vanished after passing the same point in the northern sky. we were pretty shocked at what we were seeing. we tried guessing what they could be but just couldn't decide on any one thing. there was one object in the first sighting (which we thought was the plane) then 3-4 about 5 minutes later. about 5 minutes after that we saw another 9 separated by a few inches in the sky. we hung around a while longer and eventually saw one final one about 20 minutes after the large sighting (heading from the east to the north).
content.summary: 14+ orange glowing objects sighted, appeared in the west, headed north then disappeared

content.detailedDescription:
1. my husband works midnights and i was walking with him out the door to say goodbye.

2. it was a fairly large object that was directly in my line of view.

3. i had no idea and my husband didn't either, we have never seen anything like it!

4. it looked like an orange fireball, it had a floating appearance but there was not even a breeze, it seemed to be moving pretty quick and it was following a distinct south to north straight line path. 

5. very shocked and in awe, i am certain i frightened my husband when i started yelling "what the heck is that!" afterwords i wish i would have grabbed my camcorder!

6. my husband and i both watched as it flew over my neighbors house and half way across the field, in mid flight and in the middle of the field it just disappeared!
content.summary: Orange orb/fireball in rural area

content.detailedDescription:
Red-orange orb, 200-500ft away, path then hovering, pulsated light on and off, path far away like stars then fade out

saw 6-10 all the same. sometimes i could see that it was one giant light/object with a much smaller light/object attatched to the bottom of it
content.summary: Red-orange orb, 200-500ft away, path then hovering, pulsated light on and off, path far away like stars then fade out

content.detailedDescription: My wife & i were watching the tapps island firework display, when 5 orange globes appeared in the eastern sky. these globes moved like an airplane, but had no collison lights flashing like the other planes in the sky. then one by one they would disappear from the sky flying straight up.
content.summary: My wife & i saw 5 orange globes apprear in the eastern sky

content.detailedDescription: My sister and i witnessed three orbs of orange/red color fly through the night sky as we were watching fireworks.  the first orb like object flew over our house and stopped for seconds and then continued on until we could no longer see it.  we then noticed a second one with a similar flight pattern and then it dispappeared into the night sky.  during the second sighting, an small aircraft (airplane) was flying in the opposite direction.  the third orb we sighted was coming from the south, but veered off into the opposite flight pattern as the other two orbs.  the third one also disappeared into the night sky.  it is a very clear night in brier.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: My sister and i witnessed three orangish orbs in the sky (3) within a two minute period.  they disappeared into thin air.  clear night.

content.detailedDescription:
While in my backyard looking to observe fireworks in the sky my attention was drawn to a bright orange orb. it was at first assumed to be a plane as i am located in a direct path of commercial planes heading for sky harbor airport. the brilliant orange light emission is what kept my attention on the object. it made no sound and moved at a seemingly slow but steady speed. it appeared from the east and took a path heading north west.

after 10 seconds of viewing the object and ruling out the possiblilty of it being a conventional craft i called for my daughter from the living room to come and verify what i was seeing. as soon as she came out i pointed at the object and asked her what color she was seeing. she confirmed that it was orange. she asked me what it was and i dismissed her question and asked her to go and fetch her mother. in a panic i also asked her to bring my phone which i later realized was in my pocket. while she summoned her mother i snapped one picture of the object but realized that the flash was on and the photo was probably not going to show anything since it was quite dark in the sky. as my wife was stepping out to see what the fuss was i turned off the flash on my phones camera and snapped another photo dissappointed because at this time the object was much further away than before. 

my wife also attempted to capture a picture of the object but by this time it was simply a small light in the very distant sky. i kept my eyes on the object until it eventually dissappered into the sky as it moved on a north western path further and further away.

after much backyard discussion and conjecture on what we all just witnessed i ran into the house and scanned through the news channels to see if there was any coverage on the event. nothing. i sent the photos from my phone to my email account and played around with the zoom to see if there was any compelling evidence that what we saw was explainable.
the pictures are not very good to that end but what is very starnge to me is that the first picture i took with the flash on appears to be a picture taken in the daytime. you cannot tell at all that it was night. i know nothing about photography but this is very odd. you can even see clouds. i went back out and snapped several pictures in the night sky with the flash on and could not get anything but blackness. i don't get it.
content.summary: Bright orange orb that seemed to move at slow but steady speed

content.detailedDescription:
In back yard swimming.Saw.A.Light going north from south.Told wife to look. that isn't. a plane what is it.. ran to house together cell phone. to
 try to vidio it ..S aw the light still going south. to north., when
 we got into front yard then lost. it beh
ind. the trees. we. felt odd after.  because we couldn't.:
 identify it we knowthe aircraft. in our. area
content.summary: Saw bright  orangish gold light  going  south  to boy

content.detailedDescription:
Sitting and waiting for the fireworks at the alachua rec center i saw 2 wavering pulsating red lights. at first they appeared to be at the same altitude. i told my wife to watch those 2 lights as the redness was not as intense as the usual airplane/helicopter lights and they were not flashing on and off but flickering sort of kind of like what a jet engine on a fighter plane looks when it is at night and kicking in afterburners but not as sharp or bright. my wife and i are both avid meteor shower enthusiasts and know the commercial flight patterns very well. we are always looking up.

i looked at the time as soon as i the lights come into view it was 9 pm eastern. appox 3 minutes into watching these 2 the shape became apparent they were triangular and the intensity of the observation increased. at 3 minutes into the sighting the rear or trailing triangle seemed to go into reverse and climbed rapidly (less that 10 seconds) until it was out of sight. the remaining triangle stopped and remained stationary for appox. 1 minute then it also appeared to go backwards and up rapidly and in another 10 seconds give or take was up and out of sight.

the objects were coming out of the northwest and i would say the height was much lower than commercial aircraft that are in the cruising altitude, in fact i would say they were the usual altitude of say a news helicopter or a plane preparing to land 10 miles from the airport. at least that is how it appeared. we live about 8 to 10 miles from gainesville airport and when a commercial jet is on the landing process it looked like the right altitude, sorry i don't know how many feet that was. the size of the triangles was appox the same size as a commercial jet from that altitude. they left no visable trail i could see and made no noise. of course the rec center was chock full of people and noise but i believe i would have been able to hear a jet or helicopter because i was intently observing these objects. the entire sighting lasted appox 5 minutes. there were no other aircraft in the area but there were several small helium filled balloons the kids were given the fireworks started at 9:30 pm sharp which was 25 minutes after these objects disappeared from view. 

all in all my wife and i were very calm and analytical. as soon as they were out of sight we watched the area for several minutes to see if they would return and they did not. there were no other fireworks displays in the distance so i ruled that out, plus fireworks do not follow a trajectory as these did. i then tried to text a friend who was in military intelligence and had quite a lot of experience in these matters. my cell phone would not send a message nor would it let a call go through. my 14 yr old daughter was at the rec center and was walking around with her friends i tried to text her to no avail a voice call did not go thru either. the phone gave me a message stating there was trouble with a connection after each attempt. finally after 4 or 5 minutes i managed to resend my texts successfully.  

neither my wife or i had no aberrant feelings like fear or dread. we were of course a tad excited about the sighting ,but, i believe that would be considered a normal reaction. i tried to take a cell phone picture but the phone was slow to load the camera because i set it to save to the micro sd chip instead of internal memory plus i was watching the 2 objects intently.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: 2 dark gray triangles red light in center which was wavering pulsing like but never out completely

content.detailedDescription: Ok, i understand it's the fourth of july. there are fireworks all over the skies. we are in the pierpont area of ventura. did anyone else see an odd stationary object in the sky s.- s.Sw of the pierpont, marina park area, over the ocean about 45 min.To an hour ago? it had no "regular" running lights. no white lights, primarily red & blue, similar to emergency lights. it was below the marine layer. colors pulsated and switched colors and then became primarily red. the event lasted at least ten min, that i witnessed. there was no air traffic in the air at the moment i saw it, & the stars were not visible due to the overcast. please tell me somebody else saw this?
content.summary: Stationary object in the sky s.- s.Sw of the pierpont, marina park area, over the ocean. no "regular" running lights. no white lights, primarily red & blue, similar to emergency lights

content.detailedDescription:
Went out to see the fireworks from my deck when i seen this bright red object come up between the fireworks and the full moon i watched it go straight up like a firework i ask my husband what is this at first i thought it was going to be a big firework,but it started to come towards us
then i asked if it was a helicopter but their were no lights flashing and 
here in butte we don't have many airplanes fly over us at night and only helicopter for emerengency. then we watched it fly over the top of us when i ran and got our bonociulars to see what it was and there was only a glowing red ball that seemed to paulsate and it looked as if there was a small cloud around it. it come from out of the south east part and flow to the north west part then just disappeared. it the 4th of july and someone else had to see what we seen tonight.
content.summary: Come out of the east from the ground up went straight up into the air then went n.West then disapeared.

content.detailedDescription:
Starting around 9:45pm, myself, my mother, aunt and uncle all witnessed a large bright orange orb north of our house , quickly moving south. as it moved across the treetop level (at unknown distance) it gradually started to change from a bight orance to a deep red, then reverting back to orange. it continued south for approximately another minute untill completely dissappearing  from sight, as if someone blew out a candle. 

about 10 minutes later, a second orange orb appeared in the same spot that the first one had originated. this one appeared to be moving at the same altitutde, but much faster on a north to south flightpath. after about 30 seconds or so the orb started to change from orange to red, but then started to dim much sooner then the first. when the orbs light diminished the boject was not in silhouete. i was a oval type ball about the size of an asprin (more then likely still a large distance away from my position). and it want into the hover i witnessed the object change direction rapidly from a hover to decent to ascent to left and right before dropping below the tree line and out of sight.

and about 15 minutes after that my mother and i noticed a thrid object. once again, an orange orb, at same altitude moving on a north to south flightpath. this time as it approached the point where the second ones light went out, this one started a slow decent still fully illuminated and dissappeared behind the tree line.

i can tell you this was not a conventional aircraft. there were airliners all over the sky that night an none were flying as fast, manuvered as quick, or went completely dark as these three objects did.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: 3 orange to red pulsating lights heading north to south

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks in las vegas.  we viewed a bright redish object come from the north heading south for 2 minutes before the light turned west and over the course of 2 minutes faded from view.  there were no flashing tail lights or any sound.
content.summary: Strong redish light heading south over west las vegas then turning west and faded from view.  no flashing plane lights

content.detailedDescription: At approx 10pm on july 4th i was outside viewing the fireworks when i saw what i thought was a glowing unexploded firework, but then it wasn't going away. it finally (about 20 seconds later) dissapeared behind the clouds. it traveled slowly across the sky, shortly followed by another red starlike light in the same direction and speed. i observed this for 3 more lights before i witnessed two coming into view at the same time, circling eachother for about 20 seconds before they also dissapeared. these were the only lights i viewed circling eachother, but in all i counted a total of 20 lights. i finally left our deck and came inside. after the 17th light i made my husband come outside to make sure i wasn't seeing things. he also saw them. they were not stopping when i came inside. i'm not sure how many came by before i noticed them either. i am very freaked out right now. i know for a fact that they were not fireworks. i also know that they were not conventional airplanes, as 3 planes flew by when they were also going by. these planes went right by these "lights", they looked completely different, also i was able to hear the airplanes and when these lights went by there was no sound.
content.summary: Starlight, red, circling eachother

content.detailedDescription: I was leaving my cousins house after watching the fireworks when my cousin pointed an unusual object that glowed red/orange in the sky. it was nothing i've ever seen, being in new york tons of planes and helicopters are in the sky at all times, but this was lower and was not showing any signs of man made human aircraft. the object moved in a northerly direction and became smaller and smaller. a few times it stopped and hovered. it became too far and too low to see where it moved to. everyone was breathless. there were weird lightningstorms to  to the east that we're contained in the clouds. the object was slow and basketball size.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Red glowing orb hovering
